message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: 
while(iter.hasNext()){
    Map.Entry me = (Map.Entry)iter.next();
    if (foundName == true){
        nextSection = me.getValue();
        nextSection = nextSection.toString();
        break;
    }
    if (sectionName.equals(me.getValue().toString())) {
        foundName = true;
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are using the '==' operator to compare strings, which compares the object references, not their values. You should use the equals() method to compare the string values. Also, you don't need to convert the value to string again as you have already defined your map to store string values.
